cheatsheet.title: Create a Project

intro.description: This cheat sheet shows you how to create a Project with an AUT.

item.title: Creating a Project with an AUT

cheatsheet.item:
<descriptioSelect:
Test > New
If you are not using the embedded database, you will need to log in.
Enter SimpleAdder as the Project Name.
Choose Swing or JavaFX as the AUT toolkit, depending on which AUT you want to start (they are both functionally the same).
Enter or browse to the executable file:
To use the Swing Simple Adder on Windows, use:
InstallationDirectory\examples\AUTs\SimpleAdder\swing\SimpleAdder.cmd
To use the JavaFX Simple Adder on Windows, use:
InstallationDirectory\examples\AUTs\SimpleAdder\javafx\SimpleAdder.cmd
To start the Swing Simple Adder on Unix, select SimpleAdder.sh. To be able to start the JavaFX Simple Adder on Unix, consult the Samples chapter of the documentation for information on adapting the AUT configuration.
Deactivate the checkbox for loading a project template (we recommend this for your own projects later though).
Click Finish.>Finish.
